Pre-Game Insights: Ireland have lost eight of their last 10 competitive matches.
Ireland are currently ranked 62nd in the world, and a defeat to Finland would hasten their decline to 70th.
Heimir Hallgrímsson is working to ‘stop the bleeding’ and build towards qualification for the 2026 World Cup.
Nathan Collins admitted to being ‘sick’ of the team’s inability to stop the slide and expressed frustration among the players.
Finland experienced success at Euro 2020 and has a strong attacking force led by Teemu Pukki, who has scored 42 goals from 123 caps.
Ireland’s squad is valued at almost €150 million more than Finland’s, but Finland’s tactical and work ethic could prove decisive.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Finland will play through former Leeds United attacker Glen Kamara and Teemu Pukki, who has yet to be ruled out despite a hamstring issue.
Heimir Hallgrímsson expressed surprise at the media scrutiny since his arrival in Dublin and addressed Richard Dunne’s suggestion that John O’Shea could replace him sooner.
